order.title: Draw Order
order.description: Determines the draw order of the values.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit of the values. e.g. Â°C or km/h

labelColor.title: Label Color
labelColor.description: Give the color as a browser standard form. Either with names like 'red', 'green', etc. or as #de432b34 where two hex digits represent Red Green Blue Opacity in this order.

valueColor.title: Value Color
valueColor.description: Give the color as a browser standard form. Either with names like 'red', 'green', etc. or as #de432b34 where two hex digits represent Red Green Blue Opacity in this order.

labelSize.title: Label Font Size
labelSize.description: The font size as number in pixels. e.g. 12 or 24

valueSize.title: Value Font Size
valueSize.description: The font size as number in pixels. e.g. 12 or 24

backgroundColor.title: Background colors
backgroundColor.description: Background color for each section. This Array is one shorter than the number of sections.

averageLatest.title: Average Latest Values
averageLatest.description: Calculate the average over the given number of newest values. (If pivoted, then per each of the pivot dataseries.) If not specified then the latest value is shown without modification.

data.title: Data
data.description: The data used to draw this data series.

pivot.title: Pivot Column
pivot.description: You can specify a column in the input data to autogenerate dataseries for each distinct entry in this column. E.g. if you have a table with columns [city, timestamp, temperature] and specify 'city' as pivot column, then you will get a gauge for each city.
